We also passed the final version of the new Federal Law on bankruptcy, which aims to promote both investment and ease of doing business.

We also ratified today a comprehensive agreement for air transport services between us and Qatar, in addition to a number of economic agreements with a number of countries in the world

Today we have adopted the establishment of the Emirates Council for Climate Change, which will set the general policy of the State in this field and supervise its plans and representation internationally

We have adopted within the national policy to read the month of reading every year and the month of March will be the month of reading from 2017, and October will be the month of reading in 2016
The National Reading Policy also includes a health promotion program for newborns and 3 bookshelves for every citizen born during his first four years of life
The national policy for reading includes changes in educational systems, curricula, evaluation of schools and higher education systems to strengthen reading in the UAE community
We have also adopted a national strategic plan for reading in six sectors of 30 national initiatives in the sectors of education, health, culture, media, content and community development
We have also adopted the establishment of the National Fund for Reading with a capital of 100 million to support voluntary reading activities in the country, and will be supervised by the Minister of Youth for Youth.

The Council will be led by a 22 year-old female Minister of State. The energy of youth will fuel our government in future #WorldGovSummit
The newly created UAE Youth National Council will include an elite group of young men and women to advise on youth affairs #WorldGovSummit
The Council will review national policy for science, technology and innovation to develop a new generation of scientists #WorldGovSummit
The UAE Council of Scientists will be established as an advisory body, and will include leading researchers and academics #WorldGovSummit
The post of Minister of State for Tolerance has been created to promote tolerance as a fundamental value in UAE society #WorldGovSummit
The Ministry of Cabinet Affairs, tasked with future strategies, becomes the Ministry of Cabinet Affairs and The Future. #WorldGovSummit
The Ministry of Development and International Cooperation will merge with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs #WorldGovSummit
We merged the National Tourism Council and the Ministry of the Economy, and developed national GDP targets for the sector #WorldGovSummit
Managing climate change makes the Ministry of Environment and Water, into the Ministry of Climate Change and Environment #WorldGovSummit
A new post, Minister of State for Happiness, will align and drive government policy to create social good and satisfaction. #WorldGovSummit
Focusing on Emirati family and society, the Ministry of Social Affairs will become the Ministry for Community Development. #WorldGovSummit
The Marriage Fund will be merged into the Ministry of Social Affairs. Nurseries will fall under the Ministry of Education. #WorldGovSummit
We are also reforming the Ministry of Labor to better manage the UAE work in this new era of development. #WorldGovSummit
An independent entity will oversee public hospitals in the UAE: a structural change to the Ministry of Health's portfolio. #WorldGovSummit
We have established the Higher Education and Human Resources Council to restructure the development of our human resources #WorldGovSummit
We are creating the Emirates Schools Establishment to manage public schools as an autonomous, semi-independent authority. #WorldGovSummit
The changes include incorporating the Ministries of Education and Higher Education, with two state ministers in support. #WorldGovSummit
The new government will have less Ministries, with more Ministers able to manage changing and dynamic strategic jurisdictions #WorldGovSummit
The President of the UAE has approved the largest structural change in the history of our federal government. #WorldGovSummit
I conclude with you the dialogue of the future .. And it is the beginning of a new journey of accomplishment and giving to the people and in asking God to help us to serve and delight # Global Summit_Governments
The Council will be headed by the Minister of State for Youth not more than 22 years .. The youth's energy is what will move the government of the future .. # World Summit_Governments
We also decided to establish the Emirates Youth Council, and includes a group of our young men and women to serve as government advisors on youth issues.
The UAE Scientists Council will review the National Science, Technology and Innovation Policy and launch programs to graduate a generation of scientists
We have also decided to establish the Emirates Scholars Council, which includes a group of researchers and academics to provide scientific and knowledge advice to the government.
The establishment of the post of Minister of State for Tolerance has been established to establish tolerance as a core value in the UAE community
Assigning the Ministry of Cabinet Affairs and the Future to the post-oil file and follow up the programs and policies related to preparing for this phase.
Change the name of the Ministry of Cabinet Affairs to become the Ministry of Cabinet Affairs and the future
To entrust the Ministry of Cabinet Affairs with the task of looking into the future and devising a strategy to ensure that all sectors of the world meet the needs of the governments
The Ministry of Development and International Cooperation was approved by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs was changed to become the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation
The Ministry of Foreign Affairs will also include two state ministers to oversee foreign aid and strengthen our international relations abroad
The change also includes the expansion of the role of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs to include the supervision of international foreign aid to governments
We decided to include the National Tourism Council of the Ministry of Economy and to set national targets for the sector's contribution to the global GDP of governments
The goal is to develop programs, legislation, policies and control to preserve a clean Emirati environment for future generations
The changes also include the transfer of climate change to the Ministry of Environment and Water and a change to the governments of climate change and the environment
And decided to transfer the community development sector from the Ministry of Culture to the Ministry of Community Development and change the name to become the Ministry of Culture and Knowledge Development # Global Summit_Governments
We have also decided on a structural change in the Ministry of Culture to focus on content, protect the Arabic language and develop the knowledge of governments
We have also created the post of Minister of State for happiness whose main task is to harmonize all state plans, programs and policies to achieve the happiness of society.
Change the role of the ministry to focus on the UAE family and society and change the name of the ministry to be the Ministry of Community Development
We have decided to merge the Marriage Fund into the Ministry of Social Affairs and transfer the powers of supervising nurseries to the Ministry of Education
The merger of the Development Authority in the Ministry of Labor and the establishment of a settlement sector in it has been approved and the change is called to become the Ministry of Human Resources and Emiratization.
We also decided to change the role of the Ministry of Labor towards managing the workforce in the country for a new phase of development and knowledge economy.
We also decided to change the name of the Ministry of Health to become the Ministry of Health and Community Protection
The role of the Ministry of Health will change to focus on the prevention and protection of society from diseases, in addition to regulating the health sector in the State
We have also decided to change the structure of the Ministry of Health and launch an independent institution for the management of public hospitals in the State of the World Summit
We have decided to set up a Higher Council for Education and Human Resources to plan and oversee the leadership of a full change in our future national cadres.
We have also decided to extend the powers of the Ministry of Education to the strategic supervision of the education sector from nurseries to higher education.
Emirates Foundation for Schools is independent and will be administered by a board of directors and will be accountable to the government for achieving national targets in education.
We have decided to establish the Emirates School for Schools to run public schools and will give full powers and independence to government schools.
The pace of variables globally in the education sector is accelerating .. It is a single system with its tools and components and results .. So look at him # Global_Government
The changes include the integration of ministries of education and higher education under one minister and with two state ministers to support him in his national mission.
The new government will include fewer ministries and more ministers to deal with dynamic and dynamic national and strategic files.
In the new government the role of ministers is strategic and organizational, and we will have a road map to outsource most government services to the private sector
And that after consulting with my brother Mohammed bin Zayed ... a new structure of the federal government has been adopted
I would like to announce today to the people of the UAE that the President of the State, may God protect him, has adopted the largest structural changes in the history of the federal government

Our goal is to push the economy away from oil. As my brother Mohammed bin Zayed said, we must prepare to celebrate the last barrel of oil we will export. Https://t.co/UFDBnYs05d
Investing in invisible infrastructure such as training, education, research and development will precede spending on visual infrastructure such as bridges and tunnels in the future
The policy also includes support for research on solar energy, peaceful nuclear energy, robotics, artificial intelligence and genome programs https://t.co/ddEGgAC9tp
Higher policy also includes support for space research, specialized aviation industries, and investment and legislative incentives to attract global pharmaceutical industries
The policy includes 100 initiatives in the health, education, energy, transportation, water and technology sectors, including a doubling of spending on scientific research 3 times until 2021
The supreme policy adopted by the Head of State includes practical initiatives, legislative revisions and financial investments aimed at pushing the national economy away from oil
The UAE has announced the high policy of science, technology and innovation, including 100 initiatives and investments of 300 billion and its aim to prepare for the post-oil world

The New law Guarantees freedom of individuals against religious intolerance and hate crimes and underpins UAE's policy of inclusiveness
The new law criminalizes any acts that stoke religious hatred or insults religion through any form of expression
The UAE today issued a new law against any form of discrimination on the basis of religion, caste, doctrine, race, color or ethnic origin
The unity of the community and its cohesion and equality among all its members without discrimination is a guarantee for its stability and happiness .. Sedition and controversy and stir hatred is dismantling him from within
The new law criminalizes any statement or act that calls for stirring up sedition and ostracism or exploiting religion to atone for individuals and groups
The law also prohibits and criminalizes all forms of discrimination on the basis of religion, creed, sect, sect, origin, race or color and establishes severe penalties
The President of the State of Bahrain issued today a law to combat discrimination and hatred, which criminalizes all forms of contempt for religions, sanctities, and speeches of hatred and atonement

Economy Economy Message http://t.co/02xCfco9uh
Regional Challenges demand clear Arab economic vision, big economic projects & effective utilization of human & natural resources
Future of Arab World depends on great developmental & economic revival, led by GCC, achieved in cooperation with our brothers and friends.
Decrease in oil prices had positive impact on growth of many economic sectors, and state of region established unique economic model for UAE
Financial sector saw double-digit growth in 2014 of some 15%, with contributions to gross domestic product reaching AED 122B
20 million tourists visiting the seven emirates in 2014, as we are working on infrastructure projects to double these numbers
National production reached AED 2.5T in 2014, with AED 450B in manufacturing industries, AED 295B in construction sector
Total compensation paid to employees in 2014 AED 410B, incl. AED 82 billion in government sector
Our exports (inclusive of re-exports) reached AED 376B, we continue to lead Middle East as global economies' largest trading partner
Our imports reached some AED 700B, non-oil sectors contributed 68.6% of GDP, goal is 80% by 2021
2014 strongest year for UAE's economy, GDP grow by 4.6% reaching AED 1.47T, non-oil sectors grew by 8.1%
Today I have published a note on the state of UAE's economy covering also an important direction for the period to come
The challenges facing our region need to implement a clear Arab vision, launch huge economic projects and exploit human and natural resources more effectively
The future of our Arab region depends on achieving a major economic and developmental renaissance led by the Gulf States combined with our brothers and friends
I would like to take this opportunity, brothers, to call for serious steps to achieve Gulf economic integration to ensure the stability of the entire Arab region
Low oil prices spurred positive growth in other sectors, and the conditions surrounding the region have established a unique economic model for the UAE
We have growth in the financial projects sector by 15% in 2014, and AED 122 billion in its contribution to the country's GDP
20 million tourists to all emirates in 2014, and we are working on infrastructure projects and entertainment facilities tens of billions to double the numbers
In 2014, the total value of production amounted to 2.5 trillion dirhams, production in the industrial sector 450 billion, and in construction and construction 295 billion dirhams
The total wages in our economic sectors reached 410 billion dirhams in 2014, of which 82 billion were in the government sector and the first in the knowledge economy
Our total exports, including re-exports, amounted to AED 376 billion in 2014, and the UAE ranks the Middle East as the largest partner of the world's leading economies
Our imports touched 700 billion dirhams in 2014, and the contribution of non-oil sectors in the national economy reached 68.6%. Our goal is to reach 80% in 2021
2014 is the strongest economic year, with gross output of 1.47 trillion dirhams, non-oil sectors growing 8.1%, GDP 4.6%
The brothers and sisters published today a message on the state of the state economy and the most important future directions, in order to promote transparency and annuality, and some of these excerpts

The Innovation Strategy requires all government agencies to cut spending by 1% and dedicate the savings to research and innovation.
The UAE invests AED 14 bln each year in innovation, AED 7 bln of which is spent on R & D. We will raise this target significantly.
The strategy focuses on 7 sectors: renewable energy, transport, education, health, technology, water and space.

Our goal is to give Dubai residents, visitors and tourists a view of their services on a daily basis because the development of services will contribute to the true happiness and comfort of the people
At each point of service, the citizen or visitor will choose from an interactive screen and in one touch how satisfied they are with the service

Every customer has the right to know the level of service of each center. Every manager needs to compare his / her services to other providers
Each government service center will display its star rating on a sign at the entrance, and external audits will insure objectivity
Classifications of all govt. service centers will be based on service quality, hospitality and delivery time
Launched a hotel-style seven-star rating system for all govt. service centers http://t.co/FyIWCW2dcF
The most important of the government service .. is the way to provide ... And the most important number of transactions satisfaction of dealers .. The value of each official is what he does in the service of people
It is the right of every trader to know the level of service in any government center .. It is the right of each official to know the level of services provided compared to the rest of the ministries ..
The new system will be applied to all government service centers with the participation of external auditors to ensure impartiality. A number of stars will be placed outside each government center
All government service centers will be classified from two stars to seven stars according to the levels of services provided in terms of quality, good reception and fast delivery.
We have launched a new system to classify all government centers according to the star rating used in the hotel sector http://t.co/g23r4lMUOH

Our message to the world is a message of peace; the stronger we are, the stronger our message.
UAE Reserve forces will consist of retired armed forces' soldiers and national service program graduates.
The Service will cover military training at the armed forces, 9 months for high school grades & 2 yrs for those with less than high school.
The National Service will be mandatory for all male UAE nationals, above 18 yrs, or high school grades; it will be voluntary for females.
The new law adds another layer to the national defense force to further protect our nation, secure its borders & preserve its achievements.
Headed today a cabinet meeting that initiated issuing The National and Reserve Service Law, under the directions of President Sheikh Khalifa
Our message to the world is a message of good and peace .. The strength of the message from the power of its sender .. And our achievements a red line must be protected with precious and precious
The arena of the armed forces are fields of masculinity, service is honor, graduating championship and our youth are the protectors of our homeland and shield and have the responsibility to defend all the soil
Protecting the state and preserving its independence and sovereignty is a sacred national duty. The new law will apply to everyone.
The reserve forces of the UAE will be formed from conscripts who have completed national service, and from military personnel who have completed their service in the armed forces
National service will include military and security exercises for recruits in the armed forces and will range from 9 months for high school graduates and two years for lower secondary qualifications
The national service will include all male citizens who have completed the age of 18 or high school and not more than 30. They will be optional for females.
The new law comes with the aim of forming an additional national defense force, with the aim of protecting the homeland, preserving its borders and protecting its capabilities and achievements.
I chaired today a meeting of the Council of Ministers, during which we began, under the guidance of the President of the State of God, the procedures of issuing a law for national and reserve service

I requested all the ministers to efficiently spend their budgets in the interest of the citizens' happiness and welfare
3.7B of the budget for health sector, 1.4B for housing programs and 400M for the marriage fund, all subject to increase when necessary
AED 18.5B of the budget has been allocated for government matters sector to provide our citizens with higher quality services
% 21 of the budget has been allocated for the education sector to be sent on general and higher education development programs
We also approved a federal budget of AED 46B for 2014, half of which will go for the development sector and social benefits
During a cabinet meeting today, we approved AED 140B as the federal budget for the coming three years http://t.co/syUW8pVSDb
At the end of our session, we also decided to introduce the New Year's holiday to Sunday, November 3rd, with our wishes for a new year of success and good for all.
We called on all ministers to spend our financial resources effectively and directly to the citizens and facilitate their affairs and provide them with a decent life
3.7 billion dirhams were allocated to the health sector, 1.4 billion to housing programs and 400 million to the marriage fund. We will not hesitate to increase them when we see a need for this.
18.5 billion dirhams have been allocated to the government affairs sector in order to develop the services provided to our citizens at home and abroad and improve the quality of government transactions
We have allocated 21% of the budget to the education sector, both public and higher, will be spent in the programs of improving public education and programs of academic excellence in our national universities
We have also adopted the budget of the Federation for the next year 2014 worth 46 billion dirhams, more than half of which was allocated to the development sector and social benefits
I chaired today a meeting of the Council of Ministers, during which we adopted the budget of the Union for the next three years with a total of 140 billion dirhams http://t.co/xTVT32CsMr
28 years ago we believed in open skies policy, Today we receive more than 130 airline companies, and we link 50M passengers across the world
The aviation sector contribs directly & indirectly with more than AED 44B to our national economy and provides 85000 job opportunities
The new airport demonstrates a new concept in which logistic and residential services integrate to form an aviation city on its own
Upon completion it will be among the largest airports in the world with 5 runways, a capacity of 160M passengers and a cost of AED 120B
Today we opened Al Maktoum International Airport for passengers
28 years ago we started Emirates and insisted that our destinations be open to all. Today, we host more than 130 airlines and connect 50 million passengers worldwide.
The aviation sector today is one of the pillars of our national economy, contributing directly and indirectly to more than 44 billion dirhams in our economy and employing 85,000 people
The new airport is part of a new concept for the cities of aviation services in which logistics services are integrated with residential units to form a self-contained community with a cost of 120 billion dirhams
The new Al Maktoum International Airport is now open to passengers. It will be the largest airport in the world with five stands and 160 million passengers.
